title: Linux ethtool Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the ethtool command in Linux, a powerful tool for retrieving and modifying network interface settings. Learn how to use ethtool to diagnose and troubleshoot network issues.

meta.title: Linux ethtool Command with Practical Examples

meta.keywords: Linux, ethtool, network interface, network settings, network troubleshooting, networking, communication

verify.name: Verify ethtool version
verify.hint: Ensure that the ethtool version installed on your system is 5.15.

verify.name: Verify network interface information
verify.hint: Ensure that the ethtool command can successfully retrieve information about the eth0 network interface, and that the link is detected as "yes".

verify.name: Verify network interface settings
verify.hint: Ensure that the ethtool command has successfully changed the speed to 100Mb/s and the duplex mode to Full for the eth0 network interface.
